intro: Melicope unifoliolata, commonly known as the single leaf melicope, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Melicope unifoliolata thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and lowland forests.
